thread.title: Coal-shipping plan divides Oakland over health, jobs issues
thread.title_full: Coal-shipping plan divides Oakland over health, jobs issues - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Rachel Swan
title: Coal-shipping plan divides Oakland over health, jobs issues
text:
Photo: Connor Radnovich, The Chronicle Phil Tagami has worked for nearly eight years to develop a project at the long-shuttered Oakland Army Base that he says will bring a “world-class” export terminal to the barren land. Phil Tagami has worked for nearly eight years to develop a project...
Oakland’s City Council has until early December to make a costly choice: agree to move millions of tons of potentially lung-damaging coal through the city each year for export, or ban the coal and disrupt — potentially derailing — a major development that promises nearly 12,000 jobs. Phil Tagami has worked for nearly eight years to develop a project at the long-shuttered Oakland Army Base that he says will bring a “world-class” export terminal to the barren land. Phil Tagami has worked for nearly eight years to develop a project...
Oakland’s City Council has until early December to make a costly choice: agree to move millions of tons of potentially lung-damaging coal through the city each year for export, or ban the coal and disrupt — potentially derailing — a major development that promises nearly 12,000 jobs.
